properties.name: Gomel Hospice Program
properties.description: Posted by Kathyr Chernobyl Children\'s Project International\'s hospice program in the Belarusian city of Gomel provides medical and psychological support for families who care for their critically ill children in their homes.

properties.name: Homes of Hope, Savin Family
properties.description: Posted by Kathyr Chernobyl Children\'s Project International\'s "Homes of Hope" program takes children out of orphanages and places them in rigorously vetted homes of their own, where they can be raised by loving parents. This program creates long term hope by breaking the cycle of child abandonment and poverty. Follow the website link to learn the amazing story of the Savin family, a family of loving parents caring for children with shocking stories of abuse and abandonment.

properties.name: Homes of Hope, Zhila Family
properties.description: Posted by Kathyr Osipovichi is the home of the Zhila Family. Follow the website link to read their amazing story. Chernobyl Children\'s Project International\'s "Homes of Hope" program takes children out of orphanages and places them in rigorously vetted homes of their own, where they can be raised by loving parents. This program creates long term hope by breaking the cycle of child abandonment and poverty.

properties.name: Homes of Hope: Gudkovskie Family
properties.description: Posted by Kathyr Chernobyl Children\'s Project International\'s "Homes of Hope" program takes children out of orphanages and places them in rigorously vetted homes of their own, where they can be raised by loving parents. This program creates long term hope by breaking the cycle of child abandonment and poverty. Starye Dorogi is the home of the Gudkovskie family ... following the website link to learn their story.

properties.name: Hook, 3241 M Street NW
properties.description: Posted by Kathyr "Eco friendly" seafood. Beautifully prepared and presented. A "scene" at night -- dress with style. Cocktails at bar, then dine, or vice versa. Evening reservations essential. Don\'t let them seat you upstairs -- it\'s depressing up there! Portions small. Treat yourself to crudos, salad, entree. Desserts are special. Servers friendly and knowledgeable. Try them for lunch too. And weekend brunch.

properties.name: Leopolds
properties.description: Posted by Kathyr 3318 M Street NWPerfect Ladies Lunch Out w/cocktails spot. Walk down Cady\'s Alley from M Street. Modern and crisp outdoor/indoor cafe, Austrian style but not what you think. More than schnitzel and brats. Cocktails, fresh salads, interesting small plates. Pastries and good coffee. Low key but fun night scene until 11 or midnight. Try the Nicoise Salad.

properties.name: Life saving cardiac surgery, Donetsk, Ukraine
properties.description: Posted by Kathyr We funded heart surgeries in Kharkiv in May/June 2008. November 16 - 22, 2008 we are headed to Donetsk. Every year over 6000 children are born in Ukraine with genetic heart disease, a dramatic increase since the Chernobyl nuclear accident of 1986. Over half of these will not receive the surgery they need to survive. Our program works because we combine life saving surgeries with local training, so that Ukrainian surgeons in rural areas can build expertise to save the youngest and most complicated cases. We plan three more surgical missions to Ukraine thorough the end of 2008, and we hope -- with your support -- to continue the program in 2009. Visit our marker in Minsk, Belarus to learn more about the program.

properties.name: Life saving kid's heart surgeries
properties.description: Posted by Kathyr  Chernobyl Children\'s Project International has funded lifesaving cardiac surgeries for hundreds of kids in Belarus at the National Children\'s Cardiac Center. Training and professional development of local physicians is an important part of the program ... this means that your donations not only save lives during surgical missions, but contribute to the training of local medics so that lives can be saved year round. As always, our long term objective is to create self-sufficiency, not dependency. In May 2008, we sent a volunteer surgical team to Kharkiv, Ukraine, where 17 young lives were saved. Through the end of 2008, we will send three more teams to Odessa, Donetsk and Kyiv for surgical and training visits. When we started our program in Belarus, more than 7000 children were on the waiting list for surgeries . . . now that number is down about 2400. We hope to duplicate this success in Ukraine, where 6000 children are born every year with genetic heart disease.

properties.name: Mie N Yu
properties.description: Posted by Kathyr 3125 M Street NWHip silk road decor, local nod at Buddha Bar. Ladies Lunch/Night Out vibe -- fun cocktails and small plates, Fun bar, with belly dancers sometimes. Food -- it\'s mediocre to ok, you would go for the atmosphere. Putamaya musik in background.

properties.name: Minsk Community Care Program
properties.description: Posted by Kathyr  Minsk, BelarusCCPI takes disabled children off the waiting list for orphanages, and provides their families with the support they need to care for their children at home.

properties.name: Sweetgreen
properties.description: Posted by Kathyr It\'s a carry out salad place. You stand in a line (usually short). Someone behind the counter constructs your salad. You pick your greens. You pick two veggies. You pick a protein. You pick a crunch. And you pick a dressing. Clean, fast, fresh, and will cost or without a drink. Efficient, friendly staff. A true carryout -- no indoor seating, a few seats outdoors. But if it\'s a nice day there are plenty of places you can eat outside in Georgetown. Try the garden of the Old Stone House, down M Street. Or a bench on the canal. Did you try it? Leave a comment.
